mn15:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
mn15:1.2.eng: At one time Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was staying in the land of the Bhaggas at Crocodile’s Bellow, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
mn15:1.2.comm: The Bhaggas were an isolated republican clan, sandwiched between the Vacchas south of the Yamuna and the Kosalans north of the Ganges. By the time of the Buddha they were evidently subject to the Vacchas. | “Crocodile’s Bellow” (susumāragira) was their capital. The commentary it was was so-named because a crocodile bellowed in a nearby lake during the founding of the city.

mn15:1.3.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi:
mn15:1.3.eng: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:
mn15:1.3.comm: While Moggallāna is known for his mastery of advanced psychic abilities, suttas such as this and MN 5 show his concern for even the smallest defects in ethical conduct.

mn15:1.5.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa paccassosuṃ.

mn15:2.1.comm: The term “invites” (pavāreti) suggests a connection with the “Invitation” (pavāraṇā) ceremony at the end of each rains retreat, where the monastics invite each other for admonition (Kd 4). The Chinese parallels confirm this connection, saying the discourse was spoken on the Pavāraṇā.

mn15:2.2.pli: ‘vadantu maṃ āyasmanto, vacanīyomhi āyasmantehī’ti, so ca hoti dubbaco, dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato, akkhamo appadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī na ceva vattabbaṃ maññanti, na ca anusāsitabbaṃ maññanti, na ca tasmiṃ puggale vissāsaṃ āpajjitabbaṃ maññanti.
mn15:2.2.eng: other mendicants to admonish them. But they’re hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They're impatient, and don't take instruction respectfully. So their spiritual companions don’t think it’s worth advising and instructing them, and that individual doesn’t gain their trust.
mn15:2.2.comm: This discourse acts as a sutta counterpart to the Vinaya rule Bu Ss 12, which lays down a procedure to deal with a mendicant who makes themselves incorrigible. The Pali origin story for that rule lays the blame on the monk Channa, the Buddha’s former charioteer, who boasts “mine is the Buddha, mine the Dhamma!” It was evidently unsuccessful, as the Buddha on his deathbed had to further lay down the “divine punishment” for him (DN 16:6.4.1).

mn15:3.1.eng: And what are the qualities that make them hard to admonish?

mn15:3.2.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pāpiccho hoti, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato.
mn15:3.2.eng: Firstly, a mendicant has corrupt wishes, having fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes.

mn15:3.3.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu pāpiccho hoti, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato—

mn15:3.4.eng: This is a quality that makes them difficult to admonish.

mn15:3.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu attukkaṃsako hoti paravambhī.
mn15:3.5.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant glorifies themselves and puts others down. …

mn15:3.8.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhābhibhūto.

mn15:3.11.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu upanāhī.
mn15:3.11.eng: They’re irritable, and acrimonious due to anger …

mn15:3.12.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu upanāhī—

mn15:3.14.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu abhisaṅgī.
mn15:3.14.eng: They’re irritable, and stubborn due to anger …

mn15:3.15.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu abhisaṅgī—

mn15:3.17.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā.
mn15:3.17.eng: They’re irritable, and blurt out words bordering on anger …

mn15:3.18.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā—

mn15:3.20.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharati.
mn15:3.20.eng: When accused, they object to the accuser …

mn15:3.21.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharati—

mn15:3.23.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ apasādeti.
mn15:3.23.eng: When accused, they rebuke the accuser …

mn15:3.24.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ apasādeti—

mn15:3.26.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti.
mn15:3.26.eng: When accused, they retort to the accuser …

mn15:3.27.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti—

mn15:3.29.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
mn15:3.29.eng: When accused, they dodge the issue, distract the discussion with irrelevant points, and display annoyance, hate, and bitterness …

mn15:3.30.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti—

mn15:3.32.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati.
mn15:3.32.eng: When accused, they are unable to account for the evidence …
mn15:3.32.comm: Apadāna means the traces or marks left behind, in this case the evidence of misdeeds.

mn15:3.33.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati—

mn15:3.35.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu makkhī hoti paḷāsī.

mn15:3.38.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu issukī hoti maccharī.

mn15:3.41.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu saṭho hoti māyāvī.

mn15:3.44.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu thaddho hoti atimānī.

mn15:3.47.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī.
mn15:3.47.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant is attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.

mn15:3.48.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī—

mn15:3.49.eng: This too is a quality that makes them difficult to admonish.

mn15:3.50.eng: These are the qualities that make them hard to admonish.

mn15:4.2.pli: ‘vadantu maṃ āyasmanto, vacanīyomhi āyasmantehī’ti, so ca hoti suvaco, sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato, khamo padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī vattabbañceva maññanti, anusāsitabbañca maññanti, tasmiñca puggale vissāsaṃ āpajjitabbaṃ maññanti.
mn15:4.2.eng: other mendicants to admonish them. But they’re easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They're accepting, and take instruction respectfully. So their spiritual companions think it’s worth advising and instructing them, and that individual gains their trust.

mn15:5.1.eng: And what are the qualities that make them easy to admonish?

mn15:5.2.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu na pāpiccho hoti, na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato.
mn15:5.2.eng: Firstly, a mendicant doesn’t have corrupt wishes …

mn15:5.3.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu na pāpiccho hoti na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato—

mn15:5.5.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu anattukkaṃsako hoti aparavambhī.

mn15:5.8.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhābhibhūto.

mn15:5.9.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhābhibhūto—

mn15:5.11.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu upanāhī.

mn15:5.12.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu upanāhī—

mn15:5.14.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī.

mn15:5.15.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī—

mn15:5.17.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā.

mn15:5.18.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā—

mn15:5.20.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharati.

mn15:5.21.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharati—

mn15:5.23.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ na apasādeti.

mn15:5.24.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṃ na apasādeti—

mn15:5.26.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa na paccāropeti.

mn15:5.27.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa na paccāropeti—

mn15:5.29.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena na aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, na bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.

mn15:5.30.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena na aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, na bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti—

mn15:5.32.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne sampāyati.

mn15:5.33.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne sampāyati—

mn15:5.35.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu amakkhī hoti apaḷāsī.

mn15:5.38.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu anissukī hoti amaccharī.

mn15:5.41.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu asaṭho hoti amāyāvī.

mn15:5.44.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu atthaddho hoti anatimānī.

mn15:5.47.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī.
mn15:5.47.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t attached to their own views, not holding them tight, but letting them go easily.

mn15:5.48.pli: Yaṃpāvuso, bhikkhu asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti, anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī—

mn15:5.50.eng: These are the qualities that make them easy to admonish.

mn15:6.1.pli: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ anuminitabbaṃ:
mn15:6.1.eng: In such a case, a mendicant should measure themselves like this.
mn15:6.1.comm: “Should measure against” is anuminitabba, which in its noun form anumāna lends the sutta its title. The normal sense in later literature is “inference” (eg. Mil 6.4.1). Anumāna occurs in the early texts only here and in the passive form anumīyati at SN 22.36:1.4, where the sense must be to “measure against”. This passage also discusses how to measure oneself in relation to another, an external standard, whereas the next section on reflection applies an inner standard. Hence the commentary glosses with: “should compare, should judge” (tuletabbo tīretabbo).

mn15:6.2.pli: ‘yo khvāyaṃ puggalo pāpiccho, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
mn15:6.2.eng: ‘This individual has corrupt wishes, having fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. And I don’t like or approve of this individual.

mn15:6.3.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ pāpiccho pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
mn15:6.3.eng: And if I were to fall under the sway of corrupt wishes, others wouldn’t like or approve of me.’

mn15:6.4.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na pāpiccho bhavissāmi, na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.
mn15:6.4.eng: A mendicant who knows this should give rise to the thought: ‘I will not fall under the sway of corrupt wishes.’ …

mn15:6.5.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo attukkaṃsako paravambhī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.6.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ attukkaṃsako paravambhī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.7.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anattukkaṃsako bhavissāmi aparavambhī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.8.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo.

mn15:6.9.pli: Ahañceva kho panassaṃ kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.10.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhābhibhūto’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.11.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.12.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.13.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu upanāhī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.14.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.15.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.16.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.17.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.18.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.19.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāressāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.20.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharati, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.21.pli: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṃ paṭipphareyyaṃ, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.22.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharissāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.23.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo codito codakena codakaṃ apasādeti, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.24.pli: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṃ apasādeyyaṃ, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.25.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṃ na apasādessāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.26.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.27.pli: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakassa paccāropeyyaṃ, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.28.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakassa na paccāropessāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.29.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo codito codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.30.pli: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicareyyaṃ, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeyyaṃ, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukareyyaṃ, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.31.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena na aññenaññaṃ paṭicarissāmi, na bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmessāmi, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.32.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.33.pli: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena apadāne na sampāyeyyaṃ, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.34.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena apadāne sampāyissāmī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.35.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo makkhī paḷāsī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.36.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ makkhī paḷāsī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.37.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘amakkhī bhavissāmi apaḷāsī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.38.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo issukī maccharī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.39.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ issukī maccharī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.40.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anissukī bhavissāmi amaccharī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.41.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo saṭho māyāvī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.42.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ saṭho māyāvī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.43.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asaṭho bhavissāmi amāyāvī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.44.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo thaddho atimānī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;

mn15:6.45.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ thaddho atimānī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.

mn15:6.46.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘atthaddho bhavissāmi anatimānī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.

mn15:6.47.pli: ‘Yo khvāyaṃ puggalo sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ayaṃ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
mn15:6.47.eng: ‘This individual is attached to their own views, holding them tight and refusing to let go. And I don’t like or approve of this individual.

mn15:6.48.pli: ahañceva kho panassaṃ sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ahampāssaṃ paresaṃ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
mn15:6.48.eng: And if I were to be attached to my own views, holding them tight and refusing to let go, others wouldn’t like or approve of me.’

mn15:6.49.pli: Evaṃ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī bhavissāmi anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī’ti cittaṃ uppādetabbaṃ.
mn15:6.49.eng: A mendicant who knows this should give rise to the thought: ‘I will not be attached to my own views, holding them tight, but will let them go easily.’

mn15:7.1.pli: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
mn15:7.1.eng: In such a case, a mendicant should check themselves like this:

mn15:7.2.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi pāpiccho, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato’ti?
mn15:7.2.eng: ‘Do I have corrupt wishes? Have I fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes?’

mn15:7.3.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
mn15:7.3.eng: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

mn15:7.4.pli: ‘pāpiccho khomhi, pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.
mn15:7.4.eng: they have fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. Then they should make an effort to give up those bad, unskillful qualities.

mn15:7.5.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
mn15:7.5.eng: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

mn15:7.6.pli: ‘na khomhi pāpiccho, na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
mn15:7.6.eng: they haven’t fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities. …

mn15:7.7.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.9.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.10.pli: ‘attukkaṃsako khomhi paravambhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.11.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.12.pli: ‘anattukkaṃsako khomhi aparavambhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.13.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.15.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.16.pli: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhābhibhūto’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.17.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.18.pli: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhābhibhūto’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.19.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.21.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti ‘kodhano khomhi kodhahetu upanāhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.22.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.23.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.25.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.26.pli: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.27.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.28.pli: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.29.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.30.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā’ti?

mn15:7.31.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.32.pli: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.33.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.34.pli: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṃ nicchāretā’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.35.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.36.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi codito codakena codakaṃ paṭippharāmī’ti?

mn15:7.37.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṃ paṭippharāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.38.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.39.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṃ nappaṭippharāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.40.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.41.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi codito codakena codakaṃ apasādemī’ti?

mn15:7.42.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṃ apasādemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.43.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.44.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṃ na apasādemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.45.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.46.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi codito codakena codakassa paccāropemī’ti?

mn15:7.47.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.48.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakassa paccāropemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.49.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.50.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakassa na paccāropemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.51.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.52.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi codito codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicarāmi, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmemi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti?

mn15:7.53.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.54.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena aññenaññaṃ paṭicarāmi, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmemi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.55.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.56.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena na aññenaññaṃ paṭicarāmi, na bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmemi, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.57.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.58.pli: ‘kiṃ nu khomhi codito codakena apadāne na sampāyāmī’ti?

mn15:7.59.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.60.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena apadāne na sampāyāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.61.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.62.pli: ‘codito khomhi codakena apadāne sampāyāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.63.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.65.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.66.pli: ‘makkhī khomhi paḷāsī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.67.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.68.pli: ‘amakkhī khomhi apaḷāsī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.69.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.71.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.72.pli: ‘issukī khomhi maccharī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.73.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.74.pli: ‘anissukī khomhi amaccharī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.75.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.77.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.78.pli: ‘saṭho khomhi māyāvī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.79.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.80.pli: ‘asaṭho khomhi amāyāvī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.81.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.83.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.84.pli: ‘thaddho khomhi atimānī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.

mn15:7.85.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:

mn15:7.86.pli: ‘atthaddho khomhi anatimānī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.

mn15:7.87.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṃ evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:

mn15:7.89.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
mn15:7.89.eng: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

mn15:7.90.pli: ‘sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī khomhi ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṃyeva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.
mn15:7.90.eng: they are attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go. Then they should make an effort to give up those bad, unskillful qualities.

mn15:7.91.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
mn15:7.91.eng: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

mn15:7.92.pli: ‘asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī khomhi anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
mn15:7.92.eng: they’re not attached to their own views, holding them tight, but let them go easily. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

mn15:8.1.pli: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme appahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā sabbesaṃyeva imesaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.
mn15:8.1.eng: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they haven’t given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should make an effort to give them all up.

mn15:8.2.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme pahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ, ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
mn15:8.2.eng: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they have given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

mn15:8.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā, daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko, ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte, acche vā udakapatte, sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno, sace tattha passati rajaṃ vā aṅgaṇaṃ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati;
mn15:8.3.eng: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.
mn15:8.3.comm: Moggallāna also takes part in a similar conversation about blemishes at MN 5:3.1.

mn15:8.4.pli: no ce tattha passati rajaṃ vā aṅgaṇaṃ vā, teneva attamano hoti:
mn15:8.4.eng: But if they don’t see any dirt or blemish there, they’re happy, thinking:

mn15:8.6.pli: Evameva kho, āvuso, sace bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme appahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā sabbesaṃyeva imesaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṃ.
mn15:8.6.eng: In the same way, suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they haven’t given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should make an effort to give them all up.

mn15:8.7.pli: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme pahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ, ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
mn15:8.7.eng: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they have given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.”
mn15:8.7.comm: The Chinese parallels continue at this point, expanding the sequence that leads from joy to immersion to insight and liberation.

mn15:8.8.eng: This is what Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said.

mn15:8.9.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
mn15:8.9.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said.
mn15:8.9.comm: The commentary says that the ancient teachers called this the “Bhikkhupātimokkha”, perhaps an echo of the memory that it was recited on the pavāraṇā, which replaces the recitation of the Pātimokkha normally held on the full moon day. It goes on to say that a mendicant should use these teachings to review themselves three times a day, or at least once.
